This allows for one imported infective per day for every million population members, for a duration of six months, and all the transmission chains they generate. Prior to the 2009 pandemic many nations held antiviral stockpiles with doses that numbered more than 20% of their population. Only a small fraction of this would be needed for sustained containment of transmission until the vaccine controls transmission.
